item.title: Director Credit Modeling and Methodology
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director Credit Modeling and Methodology

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology will lead the development of RBC’s Wholesale AIRB (Advanced Internal Ratings Based) regulatory capital parameters from a data infrastructure perspective.

You will focus on leading a team building out the infrastructure for data ingested for modeling Wholesale parameters: PD, LGD and EAD monitoring and development. You will assist the Senior Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology in the execution and maintenance of tools and processes that support model development and performance monitoring.  You will assist Senior Management and the Board in understanding critical parameter estimation issues relating to credit risk parameters.

We are looking for a strong high-performing leader to become a key partner on the data side of quantitative model development. We are a team that prides itself for high quality work with significant impact across the bank and continuous interaction with other groups, senior management and regulators. Given the nature of our work, the opportunity to learn, grow and expand your network is significant. 

What will you do?

  • Manage in an iterative manner the creation and improvement upon Wholesale processes and credit risk data used at RBC

  • Lead a team of qualified subject matter experts in all manner of data analytics

  • Investigate industry leading data tools and methods to be leveraged in data mining, analysis & visualization

  • Participate actively in the exchange of knowledge relating to parameter estimation, data & analytical methodology 

  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to

  • Provide data Governance expertise ensuring linkage across all sources and all reporting produced to optimize accuracy, efficiencies and manage redundancies

  • Provide analytical support on Ad Hoc requests originating from various stakeholders

 What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong leadership capabilities to provide mentorship to a team of data analytics professionals

  • Wholesale credit risk modeling knowledge and lending products data acumen

  • Strong data manipulation capability with advanced SQL programming skills; experience in SAS, Python or similar tools

  • Effective and equally conversant in translating technical expertise into business language that drive insights

  • At least 5 years working experience with lending products and related databases

  • Advanced knowledge and working experience with relational databases and data visualization tools

 Nice-to-have

  • Degree in quantitative field of study (e.g. Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science) – to demonstrate capability for critical thinking and data analysis

  • Experience in the Financial industry

  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment

  • Expertise in navigating an Enterprise Data Warehouse, experience with Hadoop environments, Python, R or other tools

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program

  • Leaders who support your development through training and coaching

  • Work with a dynamic, collaborative team with ability to make a difference

Job Summary

Lead the team responsible for data infrastructure used in Wholesale Parameter Estimation, a process that generates ~$200bn RWA. Accountable for the analysis and oversight of the data behind Wholesale parameters.

item.title: Manager, Global AML CRR and Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Job Title

Manager, Global AML CRR and Reporting

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Manager, AML Client Risk Rating (CRR) Reporting and Metrics is mandated to develop and maintain accurate and timely Anti-Money Laundering/Anti-Terrorist Financing (AML/ATF) reports including board reports, management reports, operational reports, audit reports and regulatory reports. Utilizing sophisticated tools and techniques, the Manager will develop and maintain new and existing reports, analyze data to provide meaningful information and continuously look for opportunities to provide more relevant and valuable intelligence to the Global AML program. 

What will you do?

  • Work collaboratively with stakeholders to gather and validate complex and ambiguous business requirements

  • Design, test and implement operational and managerial reports and make enhancements to existing reports

  • Prepare daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting solutions in accordance with existing Service Level Agreements (SLAs), lead and support ad hoc data/report requests for regulators and internal stakeholders adhering to existing SLAs

  • Interpret analytics results and present findings to senior management team

  • Partner with Business Intelligence developers to design and develop optimal solutions for analysis and value added reporting.

  • Lead and support in developing  operational metrics and corporate Key Performance Indicators

  • Analyze business data to identify quality and integrity issues in partnership with the IT Department

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Experience handling a large volume of data

item.title: Senior Analyst, Stress & Impairment
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Stress & Impairment

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Senior Analyst, Stress & Impairment will support the execution of live production and infrastructure maintenance for our Credit Measurement System (CMS), which employs a collection of models used to estimate and report forward-looking expected credit losses (ECL), primarily for loans in RBC’s banking book portfolios.

What will you do?

  • Assist in the execution and maintenance of time-sensitive IFRS 9 and CECL live production runs in CMS. 
  • Support requests from model builders, validators and auditors regarding data and methodology aspects associated with the credit loss models
  • Develop and/or implement testing and reporting methodologies, including model testing, calibration and monitoring performance
  • Assist in preparation of technical whitepapers and presentations, as well as other documents pertaining to implemented models, technologies, and/or analyses
  • Perform scenario/change impact analyses for communication to Senior Management, with focus on business and risk implications
  • Facilitate integration and automation of modeling and reporting changes in CMS and their promotion to BAU production processes
  • Role focus: analytical and statistical technical tools used for credit risk, data and change management, methodology development & implementation
  • Tailor best solutions based on materiality, timelines and available resources
  • Research and keep abreast on credit methodologies and data analytics, to ensure RBC is a leading institution on best practices across the industry

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Undergraduate, and preferably graduate, degree in a quantitative discipline such as physics, mathematics, statistics, engineering, economics, econometrics, actuarial science, finance and/or relevant professional qualifications, with focus on quantitative statistical and analytical skills
  • 1+ years of relevant business work experience in quant groups (risk, front office, etc.) in the financial industry
  • 1+ years of programming experience with tools such as SAS, SQL, Python, Excel/VBA.
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Strong conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills.  Ability to tailor analysis to required level of precision

Nice-to-Have:

  • FRM and/or CFA would be an asset
  • Prior work experience in credit risk modeling, stress testing, credit portfolio analysis, and credit provisioning would be an asset.

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

The Senior Analyst, Stress & Impairment will support the execution of live production and infrastructure maintenance for our Credit Measurement System (CMS), which employs a collection of models used to estimate and report forward-looking expected credit losses (ECL), primarily for loans in RBC’s banking book portfolios.

You will focus on models for Wholesale, Retail and Capital Markets products, with opportunity to expand and grow through time in other related areas. You will assist Senior Director and Director Stress & Impairment in the execution and maintenance of forward-looking banking-book credit loss projection models and IFRS 9 and CECL credit provisioning and loan portfolio stress testing requirements. You will assist Senior Management and the Board in understanding critical measurement issues relating to forward-looking portfolio performance matters.

The team has significant impact across the bank and continuous interactions with other groups, including Senior Management and regulators.

item.description:

Job Title

Claims Reporting Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

As a Claims Reporting Analyst, you will provide reporting and analytics support to for the Life and Health Claims Department at RBC Insurance. You will be responsible for ensuring the effectiveness and efficiency of reporting while creating high quality analyses and insights. The role will focus heavily on the timely and accurate delivery of data, information and insight to the end user. If this sounds like you, we want to meet you.

What will you do? 

• Perform deep dive analyses of the Life & Health department data to generate actionable client insights reporting

• Design business analysis utilizing recording systems for use throughout the Life & Health department.

• Accurately analyze and collect data for various types of business reports.

What will you need to succeed?

Must Have

item.title: Sr. Data Analyst – Campaign Decisioning
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Data Analyst – Campaign Decisioning

Job Description

What will you do?

Our team is the Client Interaction Decision Management (CIDM) team. We are looking for a passionate, energetic and talented data enthusiast to join our team. This is a hybrid/technical role where we collaborate with Marketing, Product groups and Channel partners to help drive business results. In this role, you will be responsible for the implementation of data-driven client treatments including direct marketing, triggers as well as other client communications. You will be considered the Centre of Excellence (COE) for client decisioning and distribution via various channels.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with key business stakeholders within Personal & Commercial Banking and Insurance to design, build and deploy data-driven client treatments
  • Evolve and optimize campaign test & learn design and build to ensure alignment to business and marketing objectives
  • Automate evergreen campaigns
  • Responsible for quality assurance to ensure the campaign requirements accurately match the design and build
  • Ensure corporate reputation is maintained by adhering to all best practices, privacy & legal guidelines, data stewardship and governance policies

What you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics or related field
  • 2+ years of experience in a data analytical role: Analytical programming languages (e.g., SAS, SQL, Python, R)
  • Ability to combine business acumen with technical expertise in order to deliver targeted campaigns on behalf of our business stakeholders
  • Agile mindset with the ability to think creatively to solve complex problems
  • Self-motivated, strong communication skills, attention to detail

Nice-to-have:

  • Experience in the financial services industry, including understanding of marketing
  • Strong desire to learn new tools and try new concepts that evolve and optimize current processes

You will be establishing and fostering strong, collaborative relationships with internal partners and continuously look for new opportunities to automate processes. You will be considered the COE for client decisioning and distribution via various channels.

item.title: Manager - Credit Risk, HEF Portfolio
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager - Credit Risk, HEF Portfolio

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The incumbent supports the Senior Manager of Consumer Portfolio Management and the Portfolio Management & Credit Strategy (PM&CS) team in managing portfolio health with a focus on Home Equity Financing (HEF) Products ($300 Billion portfolio). The incumbent identifies trends and develops insights and makes recommendations to Portfolio Management & Credit Strategies (PM&CS) on performance and loss forecast. This role gives the incumbent the opportunity to build on these strengths: cross-enterprise mindset, understanding of consumer behaviour and RBC risk appetite, and adaptability to the dynamic credit environment. This position specializes in insight-generation through in-depth portfolio.

What Will You Do?

  • Use data to generate insights and support HEF portfolio analytics across the entire credit value chain and identify trends that support recommendations on acquisition, performance and loss forecast.
  • Deliver timely and accurate analytics by: Understanding business and regulatory reporting need, and establishing analytical framework. Performing all manner of data mining activities, including data validation. Summarizing findings, and communicating to stakeholders
  • Develop and execute routines to measure and monitor effectiveness of policy and process changes to determine success and make adjustment recommendations where required
  • Ongoing portfolio monitoring and commentary and provide regular performance updates to stakeholders
  • Partner with teammates to design incisive and meaningful risk-monitoring measures used to maintain overall portfolio quality
  • Have shared responsibility for building, validating, and automating new metrics and reports.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Degree in Engineering, Statistics or other quantitative field of study
  • Significant experience with:
    • Advanced SQL skills
    • Strong SAS/Python or equivalent programming experience
    • Expert in MS Excel and PowerPoint
    • Effective and conversant in business and technical environment
    • Proven analytical skills
    • Good understanding of consumer behaviour and credit risk
  • Collaborative and supportive attitude
  • Creative thinker
  • Strong Attention to detail

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of Teradata, DB2, Oracle
  • Familiarity with Tableau, R languages
  • Working knowledge of consumer credit products
  • Experience in credit risk

item.title: Director, Business Research Design, CXDI
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Business Research Design, CXDI

Job Description

What is the opportunity?
This is an exciting role in which you will have the opportunity to accelerate shareholder value through perceived understanding and translation of the needs of clients, communities, employees and RBC’s performance.  An integral role, supporting the Senior Director of Research to inform senior level decision makers on key opportunities and risks in RBC’s communication and key strategic initiatives.   Using cost effective and innovative research methodologies you will lead research studies for RBC enterprise ensuring that the business units are provided with timely, actionable, high quality client insights to support their decision making process.   In this role you will interpret and integrate client and research findings and proactively share the insights across the enterprise to develop differentiating strategies and solutions that supports revenue growth and RBC’s competitiveness in the marketplace.

What will you do?

  • Lead the interpretation and integration of customer insights from various sources including primary market research data, secondary sources including industry and consumer trends, data sources from various RBC touchpoints and proactively sharing the insights across the enterprise to develop differentiating strategies and solutions that supports revenue growth – Key focus on RBC’s Business Banking properties

  • Consult with business units to effectively understand and define their business needs, translate the business needs into research needs and propose most appropriate recommendations

  • Manage key vendor relationships on highly complex and enterprise based research initiatives to meet the various needs of the businesses and ensure RBC’s competitive advantage in sourcing and delivering industry leading customer insights.

  • Continually innovate RBC research practice to improve efficiency and RBC research  story telling skills to enhance impact

  • Enhance RBC’s innovative research solutions including our online research community of Business Banking clients.   by continuously engaging through the planning and execution of qualitative and quantitative research studies (using in-house tools)

  • Lead the design of  marketing research studies to generate client insights to support BUs/FUs/ strategies, business plans and programs

  • Leverage knowledge from RBC’s Client Experience Design & Insights (CXDI) team and the enterprise to uncover better insights by bringing in multiple information sources

  • Participate in cross-functional teams to signal market trends, identify business opportunities & emerging market segments, and relevant positioning, value proposition and potential product development/ enhancements

  • Guide the business unit to effectively define the client insights gaps and provide recommendations on the best approach or solutions.

  • Test and learn new and enhanced methodology including new measurement metrics to achieve the highest standard in research excellence

  • Develop and implement strategies to make all deliverables faster, simpler and better.

Managerial Excellence

  • Assist in coaching CXDI professionals to enhance their skill sets and proficiency in story telling with a dotted line management of at least one research associate

  • Manage external research vendors to achieve quality deliverables in a cost effective manner

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Senior marketing researcher - 8 to 10 years at a senior role in marketing research as either a research supplier or buyer with accountability for at least $2MM in research sales or spend.

  • Demonstrated superior leadership in a cross-functional and information sharing environment with proven record of attaining consistently high level of business impact and influence.

  • Superior ability to translate complex research data into precise and simple information for business partners.

  • Strong knowledge and practical experience on a wide range of research techniques covering both qualitative (including working as a group moderator) and quantitative areas. Superior ability to decide on the appropriate research methodologies and data analyses required.

  • Superior story telling skills and people skills.

  • Detail oriented and quality focus.

  • Sound working knowledge of marketing principles, concepts and tactics.

  • Strong analytical strategic mindset.

  • Self-starter, able to manage simultaneously a large number of projects which differ in complexity and business context in a fast-paced environment.

  • Creative and innovative thinker who can think outside of the box.

  • Active listener and open to new ideas/concepts.

Nice-to-have

  • Degree in related field. MBA/Masters in related field preferred. 

  • Experience with B2B research methodologies, techniques and sample management

  • Experience in statistical modeling (SPSS, RStudio or comparable)

  • Working French proficiency


​What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best with progressive thinking to keep growing and by working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is sustainable and beneficial to all parties.

  • A professional and supportive team environment 

  • Competitive Compensation

  • A comprehensive training program on internal processes and systems 

  • Career progression if you have what it takes to be the best

item.title: HR Data Management Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

HR Data Management Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a HR Data Management Analyst, you will identify and collect data sources, analyze and extract key data and information, evaluate and monitor data quality to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements.

What will you do?

  • Identifies and collects data sources using specific tools or techniques; inputs them into the organization\'s information system.
  • Provides data flow diagrams and documents the processes used in a company databases.
  • Assists and participates in data validation and cleaning to ensure the quality and integrity of data.
  • Analyzes and extracts key data and information to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements.
  • Run exception reports in Workday to identify data discrepancies such as job profiles with invalid compensation codes and update codes accordingly
  • Review compensation exception items in Workday, analyze the data and work with the appropriate teams to make data corrections
  • Work with various teams, including domain leads and HRCT to understand data discrepancies and bring to resolution
  • Manage day to day data operational requests by monitoring incoming data requests in the Data Management group inbox
  • Create /update incentive codes related to Advanced Compensation in SAP tables
  • Enter org units in SAP legacy system when Finance creates a new cost center in source system (FiBRS)
  • Execute and review exception reports and correct data discrepancies in source system for job profiles, org changes and cost center changes
  • Enter exceptions in SAP legacy system for Short Term Incentive deferral payment
  • Maintain tables in SAP legacy system for Business Purpose and Organization requirements to ensure accuracy between Workday and SAP
  • Update job country specific attributes in SAP ad hoc based on requests received in Data Management generic mailbox
  • Support team communication for changes related to data discrepancies and audit checks
  • Work in collaboration with Digital Solutions strategy team to prioritize work and exchange information including participation in weekly team meetings, planning activities and ad hoc requests to support team deliverables

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience in data entry and data analysis

Nice-to-haves:

  • Experience with Workday and/or cloud based technology
  • Knowledge of HR practices, policies and systems
  • Familiarity and experience in using the SAP HR system

What\'s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater scopes of work

Job Summary

Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements. Applies complete knowledge, skills, and practices to perform assignments.
